page.title: 05St. Mary's Church, Shapwick
page.content: No firm date can be given to when the first church in Shapwick was built.There have been a church in Shapwick in the early{8th century.}It is by{Beerway Farm}about half a mile East of the present Church.Electric lights were installed in 1936 and the paraffin lamps removed.The oil lamps are used once a year at the candle and lamp service.From 1345 to 1353 no less than six vicars were appointed.This was probably because the{Black Death broke out in Somerset in 1349.The vicarage was built in 1926,the original was{burnt down}in 1920 in the early morning of Dec.15th.The flames spread quickly and the fire brigade of Glastonbury arrived too late because the horses slipped on the icy roads. The vicar's valuable library and most of the downstairs furniture were saved by the villagers.
